thread.title: After chaotic protests in CapeTown Klipheuwel police will continue patrolling

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: After chaotic protests in CapeTown Klipheuwel police will continue patrolling
text:
After chaotic protests in CapeTown Klipheuwel police will continue patrolling   
Aug 25, 2015 eTN   
Western Cape officials in South Africa say police officers will continue patrolling the Klipheuwel area following chaotic protests. 
A neighbourhood watch group in the Klipheuwel area in Capetown, South Africa said protesting residents from a local informal settlement have been causing chaos in the community over the past few days. 
The Mukpunt neigbourhood watchâ€™s Lourens Steyn said a large part of the area had also been left without electricity after protesters allegedly Some protestors are throwing stones at police, others are burning tyres in the road and officers have retaliated with rubber bullets. Demonstrators are taunting police, saying they are not scared of them. 
The protests are not in an area often visited by tourists.
